717614f-b.text:
(1)
The Hotel Dauphin, Broadway at the S.W. corner of 67th Street, seen from Columbus Avenue across the clearing on the site of the 104th Field Artillery Armory, which was demolished the previous year. Adjoining the Dauphin is the Marie Antoinette.
January 10, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
April 10, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

717613f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, from 67th to 68th Streets, seen from Columbus Avenue across the clearing on the site of the 104th Field Artillery Armory. The Hotel Dauphin is at the left.
January 10, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing also the south side of 68th Street, west from,
but not including, Columbus Avenue.
April 10, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)

717612f-a.text:
Broadway at, adjoining, and south of the S. E. corner of W. 67th Street (left), showing respectively the Simpson Building, the Campbell Funeral Church and the Lincoln Square Building as viewed in a northeastward direction. To the left appears a portion of the subsequently demolished 1st Field Artillery Armory. This occupied the entire 67th 68th Street block, east from Broadwav to Columbus Avenue. View 2 is limited showing mainly the aforementioned Simpson and Campbell Buildings. Whe latter in 1940 will vacate this structure. Note at the left the tax payer,
erected in 1922, on the former Armory site.
October 13, 1927
P. L. Sperr
May 9, 1938
George D. Chinn

717612f-b.text:
Broadway at, adjoining, and south of the S. E. corner of W. 67th Street (left), showing respectively the Simpson Building, the Campbell Funeral Church and the Lincoln Square Building as viewed in a northeastward direction. To the left appears a portion of the subsequently demolished 1st Field Artillery Armory. This occupied the entire 67th 68th Street block, east from Broadwav to Columbus Avenue. View 2 is limited showing mainly the aforementioned Simpson and Campbell Buildings. Whe latter in 1940 will vacate this structure. Note at the left the tax payer,
erected in 1922, on the former Armory site.
October 13, 1927
P. L. Sperr
May 9, 1938
George D. Chinn

717616f-b.text:
(1)
The 104th Field Artillery Armory, Broadway, east side, fro 68th to 67th Streets. This structure will be demolished in 19 and the block which it occupies will still be vacant in 1936.
June 21, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)Broadway at the South Est corner of West 67th Street,look across the clearing or parking space towards Amsterdam Avenue background may be noted buildings,which face on Central Pnrk The cleared space is the former site of the I04th Field A)
Armory.
October 9th,I960
P.L.Sperr,
